revised_title: A Detailed Description of the Native Gold Discovery in Ireland
tldr: The author provides a detailed account of the native gold discovered in Ireland, describing the location, geological context, and methods used by locals to extract the gold. The gold was found in a ravine with a constant water source, making it easy to separate from surrounding materials. The author suggests more efficient methods for gold extraction and estimates that during a six-week period, gold worth three thousand pounds was sold to various individuals.
